input: Write an AWS CDK **Python** app that creates a private VPC with two isolated subnets and an S3 Gateway Endpoint. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib) when you write code. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Using CDK (Python), define a Lambda@Edge function that adds a security header and attach it to a CloudFront distribution. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib) when you write code. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write an AWS CDK **Python** app that builds a public–private VPC with NAT Gateways in two AZs and publishes the VPC ID as an SSM Parameter. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib). Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Create a CDK (Python) stack that provisions an encrypted Amazon S3 bucket with bucket-level access logging and an AWS Config rule ensuring all buckets are encrypted. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Using CDK (Python), deploy an API Gateway HTTP API backed by two AWS Lambda functions behind a single stage. Include Canary deploy configuration via CodeDeploy. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a CDK (Python) app that sets up an Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL cluster spanning three AZs with automatic backups and a Data API endpoint. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Define an Amazon ECS Fargate service (Python CDK) running behind an Application Load Balancer with auto-scaling based on CPU utilisation. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Using CDK (Python), create an AWS Organizations multi-account setup with a Dev and Prod account, a shared networking account hosting a centralized Transit Gateway, and SCPs that deny public S3 access. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a CDK (Python) stack that enables AWS CloudTrail, stores logs in an encrypted S3 bucket, and streams them to CloudWatch Logs with metric filters for root-account usage. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Create a CDK (Python) construct that attaches AWS Budgets to a specific account, sending email and SNS alerts at 80% and 100% of a monthly cost threshold. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Using CDK (Python), build a CloudFront distribution with an Origin Access Control (OAC)–protected S3 origin, and attach a WAF v2 ACL blocking common exploits. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a CDK (Python) app that provisions an Amazon Cognito user pool with an app client supporting OAuth2 implicit flow, plus a Lambda trigger that enforces custom password policy. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Define a CDK (Python) pipeline using CodePipeline that pulls from GitHub, synthesizes with CDK v2, runs unit tests, and deploys to two stages (Test and Prod) with manual approval between them. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

With CDK (Python), create a SageMaker training pipeline that pulls data from an encrypted S3 bucket, launches an ML training job on a GPU instance, and stores model artifacts in S3. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Using CDK (Python), build an event-driven architecture where an SQS queue triggers a Lambda function that writes records to DynamoDB with on-demand capacity and point-in-time recovery. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Create a CDK (Python) stack that deploys an Amazon RDS MySQL Multi-AZ instance with read replica and enforces IAM database authentication. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a CDK (Python) app that builds a basic data lake: an S3 raw zone with object-level encryption, AWS Glue Data Catalog crawler, and an Athena workgroup configured for encrypted query results. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.
Define a CDK (Python) construct that sets up DynamoDB Global Tables across us-east-1 and eu-west-1 with on-demand backup enabled. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Using CDK (Python), provision an Amazon EKS cluster with Fargate profiles for dev and prod namespaces, cluster logging to CloudWatch, and an ALB Ingress Controller. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Create a CDK (Python) stack that orchestrates a Step Functions state machine executing three Lambda micro-services (validate, process, notify) with error handling and retries. Use AWS CDK v2. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app to create an S3 bucket with versioning enabled. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib). The bucket should have public access blocked and server-side encryption enabled using AES-256. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app that creates an S3 bucket with versioning enabled. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib) to define the bucket. Ensure the bucket has public access blocked and is encrypted using the default AWS-managed KMS key. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app that creates a simple Lambda function. The Lambda function should have a basic inline code that returns a fixed string message, 'Hello from Lambda!'. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib). Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app to create a simple Lambda function. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib). The Lambda function should have a runtime of Python 3.9, a timeout of 5 seconds, and log to CloudWatch. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app that creates a DynamoDB table. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib). The table should have a partition key named 'id' of type string and be provisioned with a read and write capacity of 5 units each. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app to create a basic DynamoDB table. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib). The table should have a partition key named 'id' of type string. Enable point-in-time recovery for the table. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app to create an SQS queue and an SNS topic. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib). Ensure the SQS queue is subscribed to the SNS topic so that messages published to the SNS topic are delivered to the SQS queue. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app to create an SNS Topic and an SQS Queue. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib) and subscribe the SQS Queue to the SNS Topic. The SQS Queue should have a dead-letter queue configured. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app that creates an AWS Secrets Manager secret with a secret value and enables automatic rotation using a Lambda function. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib). Ensure the Lambda function has necessary permissions to rotate the secret. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app that creates a basic AWS Secrets Manager secret to store sensitive information. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib). The secret should be encrypted using a default AWS managed KMS key. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app to deploy a highly available, enterprise-grade containerized application using the following components: 1) An Amazon VPC with two public and two private subnets in different availability zones for high availability. 2) An Amazon ECS cluster with Fargate launch type to run a containerized web application. 3) An Application Load Balancer (ALB) to distribute incoming traffic across ECS tasks in different AZs. 4) An Amazon ECR repository to store container images. 5) Enable auto-scaling for ECS tasks based on CPU utilization. 6) Use AWS Secrets Manager to securely store and retrieve application secrets. 7) Set up an Amazon CloudWatch log group for application logging. Ensure the architecture supports blue-green deployments using ECS service deployment capabilities. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib). Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app that sets up a highly available, secure, and scalable containerized application environment using AWS Fargate. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib) to create the following resources: 
1. A VPC with public and private subnets across two availability zones. 
2. An ECS Cluster configured for Fargate with an auto-scaling group for tasks. 
3. An Application Load Balancer (ALB) with a listener to distribute traffic to a Fargate service. 
4. An ECR repository for container images. 
5. An AWS App Runner instance to demonstrate blue-green deployments for testing new versions of the application. 
6. Implement security best practices, including security groups and IAM roles with least privilege. 
7. Ensure high availability by deploying resources across multiple availability zones. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app that sets up a comprehensive analytics architecture. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib). The app should create the following resources: 1. An S3 bucket for storing raw data with versioning enabled and server-side encryption. 2. A Kinesis Data Stream for real-time data ingestion, configured with multiple shards for high availability. 3. A Glue ETL job to process data from the Kinesis stream and store the transformed data into a different S3 bucket. 4. An Athena database and table to query the processed data stored in S3, with a workgroup configured for query optimization. 5. A QuickSight dashboard to visualize the Athena query results, ensuring IAM roles and policies are set for secure access. 6. Enable Lake Formation to manage data permissions and enforce security policies across the data lake. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app to build an advanced analytics platform. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib) to create the following resources: 1) An S3 bucket to store raw data with encryption enabled, 2) An AWS Glue job to transform the data, 3) A Kinesis Data Stream to ingest streaming data, 4) An Athena database and table to query transformed data, 5) A QuickSight dashboard for data visualization, and 6) An AWS Lake Formation setup to manage permissions and secure access to the data lake. Ensure high availability and disaster recovery by deploying resources across multiple availability zones. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app to deploy a highly available, enterprise-grade web application architecture. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib) to create the following resources: 1) A VPC with public and private subnets across two availability zones. 2) An Application Load Balancer (ALB) spanning the public subnets. 3) An Auto Scaling group of EC2 instances in the private subnets, configured for health checks and scaling policies. 4) An Amazon RDS MySQL database in a Multi-AZ configuration for high availability. 5) A Route 53 hosted zone with a failover routing policy for the ALB. 6) Enable AWS Global Tables for DynamoDB across two regions (use us-east-1 and us-west-2) to ensure data redundancy and low latency. 7) Implement IAM roles and security groups to ensure least privilege access and secure communication between resources. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app to create a highly available, multi-region web application architecture. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib) to deploy the following resources: a VPC with public and private subnets in two availability zones, an Auto Scaling group for EC2 instances running a web server in each subnet, an Application Load Balancer to distribute traffic, Route 53 for DNS management and failover between regions, DynamoDB Global Tables for data replication across regions, and IAM roles with least privilege for EC2 instances. Ensure the stack is set up for disaster recovery with automatic failover. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app to implement a complex event-driven architecture for processing customer orders. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib). The app should create the following resources: 
1. An Amazon EventBridge event bus for handling custom events.
2. An Amazon SQS queue for buffering events and ensuring message durability.
3. An Amazon SNS topic to notify downstream services of order status updates.
4. An Amazon Kinesis Data Stream to process and analyze order data in real-time.
5. An AWS Lambda function triggered by EventBridge to process incoming events and publish messages to SQS and SNS.
6. Another AWS Lambda function to consume messages from the SQS queue and send data to the Kinesis stream.

Ensure the EventBridge bus and Lambda functions are configured for high availability across multiple Availability Zones. Implement IAM roles and policies to enforce least privilege access for all services. Use environment variables to configure Lambda functions securely. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app to create a sophisticated event-driven architecture. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib) to build an application that includes the following components: 1. An Amazon EventBridge rule that triggers on a specific schedule. 2. An AWS Lambda function, triggered by the EventBridge rule, that processes incoming events. 3. An Amazon SQS queue where processed events are sent for further handling. 4. An Amazon SNS topic that triggers another Lambda function when a message is published to it. 5. An Amazon Kinesis Data Stream that receives data from the second Lambda function for real-time processing. Ensure high availability by deploying Lambda functions across multiple Availability Zones. Implement security best practices by using IAM roles with least privilege for all Lambda functions and encrypt data at rest for SQS and Kinesis. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app that sets up a secure web application architecture. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib) to create the following resources: 1) An AWS KMS key for encrypting sensitive data. 2) AWS Secrets Manager to store database credentials securely, encrypted with the KMS key. 3) An Application Load Balancer (ALB) protected by AWS WAF for web traffic filtering. 4) An Auto Scaling group of EC2 instances deployed across multiple Availability Zones for high availability. 5) Enable AWS Security Hub and AWS GuardDuty for continuous security monitoring and threat detection. 6) Create IAM roles and policies to grant necessary permissions for each service while following the principle of least privilege. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.

Write a Python AWS CDK v2 app that creates a secure, multi-region architecture for an enterprise application. Use AWS CDK v2 (aws-cdk-lib) to deploy the following resources: 1) An AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key to encrypt data across all services. 2) AWS Secrets Manager to store sensitive configuration parameters. 3) An AWS Web Application Firewall (WAF) associated with an Application Load Balancer (ALB) to protect against common web exploits. 4) AWS Security Hub and AWS GuardDuty enabled for threat detection and compliance monitoring. 5) An IAM role with least-privilege permissions to allow Lambda functions to decrypt secrets and log to CloudWatch. Ensure the ALB is deployed across multiple availability zones for high availability. Emit a complete CDK app that can be synthesized.
